div.ab: passing through so well. But for this effect, choose yellow and natural raw silk because it is stronger and rejects flour as horsehair does.

div.head: To recognize good azur dust for oil
div.ab: The one that piles up in small clods and is lumpy is the best because it is finer. Also the one that is also very pale in color, because oil darkens it. Certain sophists mix them together, but you will find this out if you pour some onto a piece of paper and lay it flat and spread it with your finger since, if it is mixed, it will be found varied and so to say with light and darker stripes, but if it is whole it will be even and of one color.

div.head: Whitening pearls
div.ab: When they have been applied in embroidery on some garment, they are greasy and may be cleaned in soapy water.

That which comes from the head of the toad and has the shape of the toad, painted naturally as you have seen, is the most excellent. It is said that if powder made from it is put on a brazier in someone's room at night, they will be unable to move, speak, or stop thieves.
It is said that if one calls a snake in Greek, saying ΟΦΗ ΟΦΗ, it will flee. Similarly, that if one calls a swine in Greek, ïon, it will come.

div.head: Candles
div.ab: Candlemakers never make good candles when the autan wind blows because they always melt, however good is the tallow they use in them.
